messages.body: $AAPL Apple includes student ID cards into Apple Wallet to help streamline university experience. https://stocknews.com/news/aapl-apple-inc-aapl-wallet-enhances-student-features/

links.title: Apple, Inc. (AAPL) Wallet Enhances Student Features
links.description: Apple, Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is integrating university ID cards to access buildings, pay for food, books, and other essential college transactions. Apple's new efforts to streamline the university experience reflect a broader effort to increase the utility of their wallet service in every day life.

$INTC ships CPUs to Apple, other OEMs?, in insecure 'manufacturing mode'. ANOTHER security blunder $AAPL $QQQ $AMD: https://www.zdnet.com/article/some-apple-laptops-shipped-with-intel-chips-in-manufacturing-mode/

links.title: Some Apple laptops shipped with Intel chips in "manufacturing mode" | ZDNet
links.description: Apple has secretly fixed a security issue affecting some laptops that shipped with Intel chips that were mistakenly left configured into "manufacturing mode." The OS maker fixed the issue in June, with the release of macOS High Sierra 10.13.5, and Security Update 2018-003 for macOS Sierra and El Capitan.

links.title: Tesla's more experienced rivals in the US auto market are feeling the Model 3's presence
links.description: When Elon Musk wrote about his secret Master Plan in 2006, he envisioned a reasonably-priced electric vehicle that can take on the best-selling fossil fuel-powered cars in the market. It took years, but the electric car that Musk mentioned 12 years ago is here, and it's called the Tesla Model 3.

Cap-Weighted ETFs Are Still Pretty Good https://benzinga.com/z/12453255 $SPY $VTI $AAPL $AMZN $CSCO $MSFT

links.title: Cap-Weighted ETFs Are Still Pretty Good
links.description: Index funds and exchange traded funds that weight stocks by market value are the dominant funds in their respective universes, but with that dominance comes some criticism. The most frequent criticism of cap-weighted ETFs, such as the SPDR S&P 500 ETF (NYSE: SPY) and the Vanguard Total Market ETF (NYSE: VTI), is that the weighting by market value methodology potentially exposes investors to stocks that could be richly valued.

$FB $MSFT $AAPL Powell says we're 'a long way' from neutral on interest rates, indicating more hike are coming https://www.cnbc.com/2018/10/03/powell-says-were-a-long-way-from-neutral-on-interest-rates.html

links.title: Powell says we're 'a long way' from neutral on interest rates
links.description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said the central bank has a ways to go yet before it gets interest rates to where they are neither restrictive nor accommodative. In a question and answer session Wednesday with Judy Woodruff of PBS, Powell said the Fed no longer needs the policies that were in place that pulled the economy out of the financial crisis malaise.
